title: Bridging Methodologies: Angrist and Imbens' Contributions to Causal Identification
abstract: arXiv:2402.13023v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: In the 1990s, Joshua Angrist and Guido Imbens studied the causal interpretation of Instrumental Variable estimates (a widespread methodology in economics) through the lens of potential outcomes (a classical framework to formalize causality in statistics). Bridging a gap between those two strands of literature, they stress the importance of treatment effect heterogeneity and show that, under defendable assumptions in various applications, this method recovers an average causal effect for a specific subpopulation of individuals whose treatment is affected by the instrument. They were awarded the Nobel Prize primarily for this Local Average Treatment Effect (LATE). The first part of this article presents that methodological contribution in-depth: the origination in earlier applied articles, the different identification results and extensions, and related debates on the relevance of LATEs for public policy decisions. translated_title: 桥接方法论：安格里斯特和因本斯对因果识别的贡献
translated_abstract: 在1990年代，约书亚·安格里斯特和吉多·因本斯通过潜在结果的透镜（统计学中形式化因果关系的经典框架）研究了工具变量估算值的因果诠释（经济学中广泛使用的方法），他们强调了治疗效应的异质性的重要性，并展示，在各种应用中，在可辩护的假设下，该方法可以恢复受工具影响的特定个体亚群的平均因果效应。他们主要因这个局部平均治疗效应（LATE）获得了诺贝尔奖。本文的第一部分深入介绍了这一方法论贡献：它起源于早期应用文章，不同的识别结果和扩展，以及关于LATE对公共政策决策相关辩论。第二部分回顾了
tldr: 安格里斯特和因本斯通过将潜在结果的观点应用于工具变量估计，桥接了两个学术领域，并强调了治疗效应异质性的重要性，提出了局部平均治疗效应，这对特定子群体的平均因果效应非常有意义。
en_tdlr: Angrist and Imbens bridged two strands of literature by applying the potential outcomes framework to instrumental variable estimates, emphasizing the importance of treatment effect heterogeneity and introducing the Local Average Treatment Effect(LATE), which is significant for the average causal effect of specific subpopulations.
